verses.verse: The same <WG1565> day <WG2250> went <WG1831> Jesus <WG2424> out of the house, <WG3614> and sat <WG2521> by the sea <WG2281> side. <WG3844>

And when <WG1722> <WG3588> he sowed, <WG4687> some <WG3588> <WG3303> seeds fell <WG4098> by the way <WG3598> side, <WG3844> and the fowls <WG4071> came <WG2064> and devoured <WG2719> them up:

Some <WG3588> <WG243> fell <WG4098> on stony <WG4075> places, where <WG3699> they had <WG2192> not much <WG4183> earth: <WG1093> and immediately <WG2112> they sprung <WG1816> up, because <WG1223> they had <WG2192> no <WG3361> deepness <WG899> of earth: <WG1093>
And when the sun <WG2246> was up, they were scorched; <WG2739> and because <WG1223> they had <WG2192> no <WG3361> root, <WG4491> they withered <WG3583> away.
And some <WG3588> <WG243> fell <WG4098> among <WG1909> thorns; <WG173> and the thorns <WG173> sprung <WG305> up, and choked <WG638> them:

But other <WG243> fell <WG4098> into <WG1909> good <WG2570> ground, <WG1093> and brought <WG1325> forth fruit, <WG2590> some <WG3588> <WG3303> an hundred times, <WG1540> some <WG3588> <WG1161> sixty times, <WG1835> some <WG3588> <WG1161> thirty times. <WG5144>
Who <WG3588> has <WG2192> ears <WG3775> to hear, <WG191> let him hear. <WG191>

Therefore <WG1223> <WG5124> speak <WG2980> I to them in parables: <WG3850> because <WG3754> they seeing <WG991> see <WG991> not; and hearing <WG191> they hear <WG191> not, neither <WG3761> do they understand. <WG4920>

And in them is fulfilled <WG378> the prophecy <WG4394> of Esaias, <WG2268> which <WG3588> said, <WG3004> By hearing <WG189> you shall hear, <WG191> and shall not understand; <WG4920> and seeing <WG991> you shall see, <WG991> and shall not perceive: <WG1492>

For this <WG5127> people's <WG2992> heart <WG2588> is waxed <WG3975> gross, <WG3975> and their ears <WG3775> are dull <WG917> of hearing, <WG191> and their eyes <WG3788> they have closed; <WG2576> lest <WG3379> at <WG3379> any <WG3379> time <WG3379> they should see <WG1492> with their eyes <WG3788> and hear <WG191> with their ears, <WG3775> and should understand <WG4920> with their heart, <WG2588> and should be converted, <WG1994> and I should heal <WG2390> them.

For truly <WG281> I say <WG3004> to you, That many <WG4183> prophets <WG4396> and righteous <WG1342> men have desired <WG1939> to see <WG1492> those things which <WG3739> you see, <WG991> and have not seen <WG1492> them; and to hear <WG191> those things which <WG3739> you hear, <WG191> and have not heard <WG191> them.

But while <WG1722> <WG3588> men <WG444> slept, <WG2518> his enemy <WG2190> came <WG2064> and sowed <WG4687> tares <WG2215> among <WG303> <WG3319> the wheat, <WG4621> and went <WG565> his way.
But when <WG3753> the blade <WG5528> was sprung <WG985> up, and brought <WG4160> forth <WG4160> fruit, <WG2590> then <WG5119> appeared <WG5316> the tares <WG2215> also. <WG2532>

He said <WG3004> to them, An enemy <WG2190> has done <WG4160> this. <WG5124> The servants <WG1401> said <WG5346> to him, Will <WG2309> you then <WG3767> that we go <WG565> and gather <WG4816> them up?
But he said, <WG5346> No; <WG3756> lest <WG3379> while you gather <WG4816> up the tares, <WG2215> you root <WG1610> up also <WG260> the wheat <WG4621> with them.

Let <WG863> both <WG297> grow <WG4885> together <WG4885> until <WG3360> the harvest: <WG2326> and in the time <WG2540> of harvest <WG2326> I will say <WG2046> to the reapers, <WG2327> Gather <WG4816> you together <WG4816> first <WG4412> the tares, <WG2215> and bind <WG1210> them in bundles <WG1197> to burn <WG2618> them: but gather <WG4863> the wheat <WG4621> into <WG1519> my barn. <WG596>

Another <WG243> parable <WG3850> put <WG3908> he forth <WG3908> to them, saying, <WG3004> The kingdom <WG932> of heaven <WG3772> is like <WG3664> to a grain <WG2848> of mustard <WG4615> seed, which <WG3739> a man <WG444> took, <WG2983> and sowed <WG4687> in his field: <WG68>

Which <WG3739> indeed <WG3303> is the least <WG3398> of all <WG3956> seeds: <WG4690> but when <WG3752> it is grown, <WG837> it is the greatest <WG3187> among herbs, <WG3001> and becomes <WG1096> a tree, <WG1186> so <WG5620> that the birds <WG4071> of the air <WG3772> come <WG2064> and lodge <WG2681> in the branches <WG2798> thereof. <WG846>

Who, <WG3739> when he had found <WG2147> one <WG1520> pearl <WG3135> of great <WG4186> price, <WG4186> went <WG565> and sold <WG4097> all <WG3956> that he had, <WG2192> and bought <WG59> it.
